body:
Hey,

As you have probably realised, tournament blacklists have now been implemented, thanks to ALM.

Currently, tournament blacklists block access to avicus.net/teams and /tournaments, which also means when blacklisted it kicks you from your team. This means you can not be on a team, and if you are on a team on an alt account and you play on a scrim server you will be permanently banned for Ban Evasion, starting from right now. If you are on a team on an alternate account and you can't leave that team for whatever reason, email officials@avicus.net as soon as possible so you are not permanently banned.

Unfortunately we had to blacklist around 45 players which is a shame after the most successful tournament yet, being last tournament. 

All tournament blacklists can be found here: 
http://hastebin.com/ebojeposef.css

To appeal a tournament ban please email officials@avicus.net. If you make an appeal on the forums you will instantly be redirected to there. Moderators, leave any tournament related ban to Officials please to save being complained at by me :D

The format of a tournament ban message is [TOURNEY] Blacklist Reason [LENGTH], and it will always stay like this from now.

Regards 

The Avicus Network Officials

If you are on a team on an alternate account and you can't leave that team for whatever reason, email officials@avicus.net as soon as possible so you are not permanently banned.

The format of a tournament ban message is [TOURNEY] Blacklist Reason [LENGTH], and it will always stay like this from now.

Regards 

The Avicus Network Officials

replies.body:
So, if team was banned because of one hacker, everyone in a team are blacklisted on every competitive side of Avicus, am I right? Isn't it a little bit cruel?
You have banned 45 regulars on our poor competitive side, and most is innocent. I think, they may just leave the server, because there is nothing to do besides scrimmages and tournaments. And you cut down number of people, who can organize stable teams, and in next tournaments we will see the same names in our new hall of fame. 
It is really unfair.
replies.body_tagged:

And you cut down number of people, who can organize stable teams, and in next tournaments we will see the same names in our new hall of fame. 
It is really unfair.

replies.body:
A team is disqualified and blacklisted if there were 2 cases of players getting banned for hacking. The team is responsible for their players, whether they know or not they were hacking. 
These people are banned anyway, they can't play the server. We wouldn't want hackers playing on our server. Them leaving really doesn't hurt us anyway. Most of them are not even regulars here.

replies.body:
@Crimson_Aught

Agreed

@DaFrozenBlaze

Dude, a leader may ask their team before the match, "Does anybody have a client enabled?", and everyone would say no. That's probably the best a leader can do to stop someone from hacking. It's the player's fault, not the team's fault, if the whole team knew the person was hacking well they should be dq'd but you can't just assume that they know if their teammates have a client enabled.
replies.body_tagged:
@Crimson_Aught

Agreed

@DaFrozenBlaze

Dude, a leader may ask their team before the match, "Does anybody have a client enabled?", and everyone would say no. That's probably the best a leader can do to stop someone from hacking. It's the player's fault, not the team's fault, if the whole team knew the person was hacking well they should be dq'd but you can't just assume that they know if their teammates have a client enabled.
